unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Surge in Rajasthan!**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Surge in Rajasthan!**

unnormalised: Namaste friends! Guess what? Rajasthan is seriously heating up, but in a good way! We're talking renewable energy, folks. Dr. Sharma at the MNRE (Ministry of New and Renewable Energy) announced a massive new solar park coming up near Jodhpur.
normalised: Namaste friends! Guess what? Rajasthan is seriously heating up, but in a good way! We are talking renewable energy, folks. Doctor Sharma at the M N R E (Ministry of New and Renewable Energy) announced a massive new solar park coming up near Jodhpur.

unnormalised: Think scorching desert meeting cutting-edge technology! The project, sprawling over 5000 sq ft, aims to generate enough clean electricity to power millions of homes. This is a HUGE step towards reducing our dependence on fossil fuels and tackling climate change.
normalised: Think scorching desert meeting cutting-edge technology! The project, sprawling over five thousand square feet, aims to generate enough clean electricity to power millions of homes. This is a huge step towards reducing our dependence on fossil fuels and tackling climate change.

unnormalised: Experts say this initiative, with investments reaching Rs. 1500 Crore, will also create thousands of jobs in the local community. Imagine, villagers from nearby areas, like Pushkar, directly benefiting from this green revolution! This park could be a game-changer for the state, potentially even exceeding 1000 km of solar panels eventually. What do you think? Let us know in the comments! Jai Hind!
normalised: Experts say this initiative, with investments reaching rupee one thousand five hundred crore, will also create thousands of jobs in the local community. Imagine, villagers from nearby areas, like Pushkar, directly benefiting from this green revolution! This park could be a game-changer for the state, potentially even exceeding one thousand kilometer of solar panels eventually. What do you think? Let us know in the comments! Jai Hind!
